intro: Anaphalis cinerascens, commonly known as the grayleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its grayish-green, woolly leaves and its showy, dandelion-like yellow flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils. It is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Anaphalis cinerascens is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
